pink primrose.fact: Pink primroses are early-blooming perennials often seen in woodlands.

hard-leaved pocket orchid.fact: Hard-leaved pocket orchids are ground orchids native to Australia.

canterbury bells.fact: Canterbury bells are popular garden biennials with bell-shaped flowers.

sweet pea.fact: Sweet peas are fragrant climbing plants known for their beautiful blooms.

english marigold.fact: English marigolds are traditional garden favorites with rich, edible blooms.

tiger lily.fact: Tiger lilies are striking orange flowers with spotted petals.

moon orchid.fact: Moon orchids, also known as moth orchids, are elegant and long-flowering.

bird of paradise.fact: Bird of paradise blooms resemble vibrant tropical birds.

monkshood.fact: Monkshood has hood-shaped deep blue flowers in early summer.

globe thistle.fact: Globe thistles are silvery-blue and highly drought tolerant.

snapdragon.fact: Snapdragons have unique flowers that resemble dragon mouths.

colt's foot.fact: Colt’s foot is one of the first spring flowers, often in damp spots.

king protea.fact: The king protea is the national flower of South Africa with a large bloom.

spear thistle.fact: Spear thistle bears spiky purple flower heads and is very spiky.

yellow iris.fact: Yellow irises often grow near water and have bright yellow blooms.

globe-flower.fact: Globe-flowers produce round, golden blossoms in damp alpine areas.

purple coneflower.fact: Purple coneflowers are popular medicinal and ornamental perennials.

peruvian lily.fact: Peruvian lilies are flashy tropical bulbs with spotted blooms.

balloon flower.fact: Balloon flowers inflate like balloons before popping into blooms.

giant white arum lily.fact: Arum lilies have elegant white spathes atop tall green stems.

fire lily.fact: Fire lilies have fiery red-orange blooms that brighten the garden.

pincushion flower.fact: Pincushion flowers have a unique flower-head that resembles pins clustered together.

red ginger.fact: Red gingers feature eye-catching red bracts and are tropically beautiful.

grape hyacinth.fact: Grape hyacinths have small clustered blooms resembling grapes.

corn poppy.fact: Corn poppies are delicate red annuals symbolic of remembrance.

prince of wales feathers.fact: Prince of Wales feathers have slender blue petals and a central disk.

stemless gentian.fact: Stemless gentians form ground-hugging blooms that thrive in alpine terrain.

artichoke.fact: Artichoke flowers show their bold thistle-like heads when they bloom.

sweet william.fact: Sweet williams are fragrant and popular in cottage gardens.

carnation.fact: Carnations are classic blooms often used in bouquets and ceremonies.

garden phlox.fact: Garden phlox produces tall clusters of fragrant summer flowers.

love in the mist.fact: Love-in-the-mist features delicate flowers surrounded by lacy foliage.

mexican aster.fact: Mexican asters bloom profusely with lavender daisy-like flowers.

alpine sea holly.fact: Alpine sea holly is known for its spiky, metallic blue blooms.

ruby-lipped cattleya.fact: Cattleya orchids are prized for their large, fragrant flowers with colorful lips.

cape flower.fact: Cape flowers are bright and native to South Africa’s shrublands.

great masterwort.fact: Great masterwort has umbels of star-shaped flowers in summer.

siam tulip.fact: The Siam tulip is a striking tropical flower from Thailand.

lenten rose.fact: Lenten roses bloom in early spring and are poisonous, despite the name.

barbeton daisy.fact: Barbeton daisies produce showy, daisy-like blooms throughout summer.

daffodil.fact: Daffodils are cheerful yellow flowers symbolic of spring.

sword lily.fact: Sword lilies have tall sword-like stems with bright blooms.

poinsettia.fact: Poinsettias are popular festive flowers with red and green foliage.

bolero deep blue.fact: Bolero deep blue is a cultivar of deep blue flowering stock.

wallflower.fact: Wallflowers have sweet-scented flowers often found on old walls or stones.

marigold.fact: Marigolds are vibrant and used in festivals and companion planting.

buttercup.fact: Buttercups are glossy yellow wildflowers often found in meadows.

oxeye daisy.fact: Oxeye daisies are hardy meadow flowers with classic daisy shape.

common dandelion.fact: Dandelions are fully edible—from roots to petals—and spread widely.

petunia.fact: Petunias are prolific summer bloomers in hanging baskets and containers.

wild pansy.fact: Wild pansies are small with pretty violet faces, common in lawns.

primula.fact: Primulas include early-spring blooms like primroses and polyanthus.

sunflower.fact: Sunflowers follow the sun across the sky—this is called heliotropism.

pelargonium.fact: Pelargoniums, or geraniums, are popular bedding plants with scented leaves.

bishop of llandaff.fact: Bishop of Llandaff is a geranium variety with striking dark leaves and scarlet flowers.

gaura.fact: Gaura has delicate blooms that flutter in the breeze, also called butterfly flower.

geranium.fact: Geraniums are hardy flowering plants often used in garden borders.

orange dahlia.fact: Orange dahlias feature bold, spiky petals ideal for vibrant bouquets.

pink-yellow dahlia?.fact: These dahlias show beautiful pink and yellow hues blended in every bloom.

cautleya spicata.fact: Cautleya spicata is an exotic ginger-like flower from Asia.

japanese anemone.fact: Japanese anemones bloom late in the season with delicate petals.

black-eyed susan.fact: Black-eyed Susans are bright yellow with a dark center, hardy perennials.

silverbush.fact: Silverbush plants have silvery foliage and simple daisy-like flowers.

californian poppy.fact: California poppies bloom in golden orange waves across fields.

osteospermum.fact: Osteospermums are African daisies that close at night and reopen in sun.

spring crocus.fact: Spring crocuses bloom very early—often poking through snow.

bearded iris.fact: Bearded irises have ruffled petals and tall stems, classic garden flowers.

windflower.fact: Windflowers are nodding blooms that open up in breezy conditions.

tree poppy.fact: Tree poppies are tall, shrubby poppies with woody stems.

gazania.fact: Gazania have bright daisy-like flowers that close at night.

azalea.fact: Azaleas produce vivid blooms in spring and are highly ornamental.

water lily.fact: Water lilies float elegantly on ponds and inspired Monet’s art.

rose.fact: Roses have been cultivated for millennia and symbolize love.

thorn apple.fact: Thorn apples bear spiky seed pods and are historically used medicinally.

morning glory.fact: Morning glories open each morning and have trumpet-shaped blooms.

passion flower.fact: Passion flowers have intricate blooms and edible fruit (passionfruit).

lotus.fact: Lotus flowers are sacred in many cultures, symbolizing purity and enlightenment.

toad lily.fact: Toad lilies bloom in late summer with orchid-like spotted flowers.

anthurium.fact: Anthuriums have waxy, heart-shaped spathes often seen as indoor plants.

frangipani.fact: Frangipanis are fragrant tropical flowers often used in leis.

clematis.fact: Clematis are climbing vines with star-like flowers.

hibiscus.fact: Hibiscus flowers are tropical blooms used in teas and as ornamentals.

columbine.fact: Columbines have unique spurred petals and attract hummingbirds.

desert-rose.fact: Desert roses are succulents with swollen trunks and striking flowers.

tree mallow.fact: Tree mallows are tall shrubs with hibiscus-like flowers.

magnolia.fact: Magnolias are ancient flowering trees with fragrant blossoms.

cyclamen.fact: Cyclamens are winter bloomers with reflexed petals and patterned leaves.

watercress.fact: Watercress is a leafy aquatic plant with small white flowers.

canna lily.fact: Canna lilies are tropical plants with showy, banana-like foliage.

hippeastrum.fact: Hippeastrums are bulbs with spectacular trumpet-like flowers indoors.

bee balm.fact: Bee balm has spiky flower clusters and is loved by pollinators.

ball moss.fact: Ball moss is an epiphytic plant often found hanging on trees.

foxglove.fact: Foxgloves are tall spires of tubular flowers, historically used in medicine.

bougainvillea.fact: Bougainvilleas are tropical vines with bright papery bracts.

camellia.fact: Camellias are evergreen shrubs with rose-like flowers, beloved in Asia.

mallow.fact: Mallows are related to hibiscus and produce colorful blooms.

mexican petunia.fact: Mexican petunias are hardy perennials with purple trumpet-shaped blooms.

bromelia.fact: Bromelias are tropical plants often with colorful bracts and rosettes.

blanket flower.fact: Blanket flowers have daisy-like blooms with fiery red and yellow colors.

trumpet creeper.fact: Trumpet creepers are climbing vines with large orange-red trumpet flowers.

blackberry lily.fact: Blackberry lilies have orange-spotted flowers and blackberry-like seed pods.
